intro: Umbilicus lineolatus, commonly known as the zigzag umbilicus, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the family. Umbilicus lineolatus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or stream banks. Its unique leaf morphology and medicinal properties have made it of interest to botanists and herbalists alike.
